subject: problems with see test output from batchtest
msgSnippet: hey guys, please help, I am new at using junit . I have 1 test case called NAPTRTest with 2 test methods in it, -- when i ran it with java command like this
messageBody:
hey guys,

please help,
I am new at using junit .

I have 1 test case called NAPTRTest with 2 test methods in it,

-- when i ran it with java command like this

<target name="runnaptr" description="test naptr"
depends="compiletests">
<java classname="sipenum.NAPTRTest" >
<classpath refid="project.classpath"/>
<sysproperty key="input" value="input" />
<sysproperty key="output" value="output" />
</java>
</target>

I saw able the all the output lines correcly, even the output
for the test method that was supposed to fail.

-- when I ran it with batchtest like this,

<target name="runtests" depends="compiletests">
<junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="true">
<classpath refid="project.classpath" />
<formatter type="brief" usefile="false" />
<batchtest>
<fileset dir="build/test" includes="**/*Test.class" />
</batchtest>
<sysproperty key="input" value="input/>
<sysproperty key="output" value="output" />
</junit>
</target>

All I saw at the output was:

runtests:
[junit] Running sipenum.NAPTRTest


What happened to all my output ?
especially the one test method that failed.
